detail.about_html:
[Português]

O objetivo desta campanha é arrecadar recursos para produzir a primeira edição internacional da revista Shmup Mania. Esta edição será escrita em inglês, e é voltada para a comunidade internacional, que ao ficar sabendo do lançamento da versão em português da revista, requisitaram uma versão internacional.


[English]

The project

The goal of this campaign is to raise funds to produce the first international edition of Shmup Mania magazine. This edition will be written in english, and is aimed at the international community, which upon learning of the launch of the portuguese version of the magazine, requested an international version.


History

Not so long ago, we did not have access to text, audio or video content as easy as we do today. Without the internet, few had frequent access to quality information about their areas of interest. Magazines came to fill that void, bringing to the crowd relevant knowledge in an affordable format.

On the video game scene, print magazines were the main sources of relevant information for decades. And in plain 21th century they are still alive. Even with the non-stop growing digital world, print magazines are still a specialized and qualified media, that keeps on spreading and preserving knowledge, in a format that is pleasant for reading and collecting.


Shmup Mania Magazine

The main purpouse of the publication is to maintain the legacy of the print magazines that inspired and taught us so much, specially during the 80s and 90s, and that undeniably contributed to the development of the video game industry.

Shmup Mania aims to revisit the classics that keep inspiring developers and players, and still motivate championships and analysis. It will also focus on the newest releases that renew the genre, bringing new perspectives of game play, visuals, sound and narrative, that catch the attention of veteran players, and also of newcomers eager to explore the fascinating world of the shmups.


Why the focus on shmups?

Shmups are our passion, and currently there are no periodical publications, in print or digital format, that addresses with depth, amplitude and impartiality the most prolific genre of video games. We will bridge that gap with a creative and colaborative magazine, that will help to keep shoot ‘em ups alive and evolving.

What will be on the magazine?

  • Reviews of the latest releases for the current and classic platforms.
  • News and rumors about releases on digital and physical media.
  • Analysis of must have collector’s editions with exclusive photos.
  • Historical facts and curiosities about the evolution of the genre.
  • Interviews with shmups' fans bringing the community to the spotlight.
  • Comparison of the several ports of a title.
  • Interviews with developers.
  • Analysis of new and classic soundtracks with details about their release on physical media.
  • Figures, toys, accesories and collectibles inspired by shmups.
  • The notable shmups for portable platforms.
  • Shmups’ Leader Boards.
  • The most famous and curious shmups’ arcade cabins.
  • The story of noteworthy producers.
  • Shmups’ archeological findings.
  • And much more!


The premiere international edition will be basically the premiere portuguese edition translated to english.

Our main goal is to evaluate the interest of the international community in the project. If the campaign is succesful, we will plan other campaigns on a quarterly basis.

Why not create the project on Kickstarter or Indiegogo?

Unfortunetly Kickstarter and Indiegogo still do not allow the creation of projects from Brazil.


The team

Our team is made of enthusiasts, specialists, experienced players and references on the creation of digital content and on the editorial market:

Douglas Silva: Physics and Math teacher, passionate about indie games, specially shmups, and video games developer.

Filipe Gracioli: Author of the blog and channel ShmupsBR.

João Carlos Árias: Enthusiast, gamer and collector of old and new video games. In love with shmups since his first contact with the genre in the 1980s.

Júlio Chiarini: Archeologist, enthusiast of old video games, member of the Mega Drive community and creator of the Kronos Chiarini channel.

Leonardo Bussadori: Graphic designer, gamer and art director of the famous Revista do CD-ROM magazine, and of many books and magazines focused on classic video games.

Paulo Vinícius Radtke: Gamer, collector, former professor of video games programming, YouTuber (Jogos Mofados channel) and member of the Clube MSX team.

Mario Cavalcanti: Journalist and the chief editor of Clube MSX magazine.

Saulo Santiago: Collector of old video games, administrator of the CloNES group (about clones of the NES and Famicom), director of the new Falcon Soft and publisher of NES games.


Rewards

For this campaign we will offer five rewards:

  • Magazine (Digital): R$27 (around US$5)
  • Magazine (Printed): R$44 (around US$8)
  • Magazine (Digital) + Magazine (Printed): R$55 (around US$10)
  • Magazine (Printed) x2: R$88 (around US$16)
  • Magazine (Printed) x5: R$220 (around US$39)


The print version will be very limited in this campaign, since we are doing a "test for echo" approach, and also due to the shipping and handling work required.


When the rewards will be delivered?

We are planning on deliver the digital copies and ship the print ones on january 2022.

If you have any questions, or need any help backing the campaign, contact us by e-mail: contact@shmupmania.com.br
